Help us improve our products and services by sharing your usage stats with us. We shall protect your personal information in accordance with our privacy policies.

"If you continue, you'll withdraw your consent to our Privacy Policy. The account currently signed in on your paired device will be removed. To delete your data stored in Mi Fitness, delete Mi Fitness services. To delete data on your paired device, refer to Withdrawal of consent in our Privacy Policy. If you're using a wearable device, a factory reset will permanently erase all your data on it. You'll need to pair your device and agree to our Privacy Policy again if you decide you use it again."

"After you withdraw your consent to our Privacy Policy, we will cease to collect your personal information. Your account will be signed out on your phone. The personal information already collected and retained will be deleted within the specific period in accordance with applicable laws and regulations unless required otherwise. To delete app data from your phone, remove this app from your phone, or clear app data in the Settings. 1. The account currently signed in on your paired device will be removed, and the related data previously stored on the server will be cleared. You can clear data stored on your paired device (e.g. sleep data, steps) with a factory reset. For further details, refer to Withdrawal of consent in our Privacy Policy. If you change your mind, you might not be able to recover the above data. To use your devices, you will need to pair with them again.
2. You'll lose all your data and content in Mi Fitness. You can no longer view your workout history and fitness data in the app. You can clear cached data for Mi Fitness and change the permissions that this app can access in Settings on your phone at any time.
If you change your mind, before using our services, you need to agree to our Privacy Policy and User Agreement.
The related data will be cleared within 15 days."

"如果您撤回对小米运动健康隐私政策的同意，您将退出登录状态，我们将会停止收集您的个人信息，并按照法律规定删除该应用所收集的个人信息，但其他法律法规对于个人信息保存期限有明确规定的除外。本地数据需要您在系统的应用设置中点击“清除数据”或卸载App进行删除。 撤销授权后，会对您产生如下影响： 1. 对于已绑定的智能设备： 所有智能设备会与您当前登录的账号解除绑定； 所有智能设备存储在云端的数据将被删除， 存储在智能设备硬件中的数据无法通过撤销授权删除（如未同步至云端的睡眠、步数数据等），如果您需要删除，请根据设备隐私政策描述进行恢复出厂设置。 上述撤销授权的后果不可恢复。如果您需要重新使用设备，需要您再次进行绑定并且重新授权。
2. 对于您在使用小米运动健康应用过程中产生的数据： 您使用小米运动健康应用过程中产生的数据将被删除（例如产生的运动记录以及健康数据）。 您使用小米运动健康应用时在手机中储存的缓存数据及您授权予小米运动健康的系统权限，需要在手机设置中进行清除和撤销。
若您要重新使用小米运动健康服务，需再次同意小米运动健康的用户协议及隐私政策并授权相关权限。"

BMR (basal metabolic rate) is mainly based on age, weight, and dietary and exercise habits. To improve your BMR: Eat a balanced diet, control your energy intake, and avoid greasy and fatty foods. Exercise for 30 minutes, 3-5 times per week.

Your BMI is high. To maintain a healthy lifestyle, exercise multiple times a week and include more aerobic exercise such as running and jumping rope. Eat a balanced diet, increase your intake of dietary fiber and high-quality proteins, and reduce intake of high-calorie foods.
BMI is normal. Keep eating healthy and exercise regularly to avoid the accumulation of abdominal fat.

Long-term obesity can lead to heart palpitations, shortness of breath, overheating, excessive sweating, fatigue, and heightened risk of chronic disease. Adjusting living habits, eating a balanced diet, and exercising more can help to reduce obesity.
Your BMI is low. To maintain a healthy lifestyle, increase strength training such as sit-ups and weightlifting, and increase your protein intake as part of a balanced and nutritious diet.

Body mass index (BMI) is defined as the body mass in kilograms divided by the square of the body height in meters. Knowing your BMI might help you understand whether your weight has any negative impact on your health.

Bone mineral is the inorganic component of bone tissue. The chemical composition of bones changes with age, affecting mineral density. Studies have shown that long-term regular resistance exercise can effectively delay bone deterioration, reduce fracture risk, and improve quality of life.

Your bone mass is low. Low bone mass can lead to lower bone density, brittle bones and weak muscles. To increase bone mass and prevent further loss of bone density, maintain good habits, get enough sleep and exercise, ensure adequate calcium intake, and increase the intake of foods like eggs, fish, seaweed, leafy greens, and soy, while controlling the intake of fatty foods.
Your bone mass is normal. Keep eating healthy and exercise regularly to slow down bone deterioration.
Body fat percentage refers to the proportion of fat in the total weight of the human body.
Your body fat percentage is high. To reduce body fat, try to exercise more, keep a balanced diet, maintain healthy habits, and get enough sleep.
Your body fat percentage is normal. Keep eating healthy and exercise regularly.

Excessive fat in the body can reduce physical abilities and increase the risk of chronic disease. To reduce body fat, exercise for 30 minutes daily, eat a balanced diet high in vegetables, whole grains, and protein, and limit intake of high-sugar, high-fat, and high-calorie foods.

Your body fat percentage is low. Low body fat can lead to malnutrition and fatigue, and in severe cases can cause low immunity and irregular menstruation. To increase body fat, consume a balanced diet of digestible, high-protein foods.

"Blood pressure is the pressure of blood pushing against the walls of your arteries as it's pumped around your body. It's written as two numbers: Systolic pressure, the upper number, the pressure in your arteries when your heart beats. Diastolic pressure, the lower number, the pressure in your arteries between beats."
The content above is for reference only and cannot be used as grounds for diagnosis or treatment.

According to the 2018 Chinese Guidelines for the Management of Hypertension regarding in-office blood pressure: high pressure (systolic) ≥ 140 mmHg and low pressure (diastolic) ≥ 90 mmHg measured three times on different days without taking antihypertensive medication can be diagnosed as hypertension. If you are currently taking antihypertensive medication, blood pressure of <140/90 mmHg may still be diagnosed as hypertension.

"Currently, China uses normal, high normal, and hypertension to classify blood pressure levels, applicable to adults 18 and over. Normal: Systolic <120 mmHg; diastolic <80 mmHg. High normal: Systolic 120-139 mmHg and/or diastolic 80-89 mmHg. Hypertension: Systolic ≥ 140 mmHg and/or diastolic ≥ 90 mmHg. The definition and classification above are derived from the 2018 Chinese Guidelines for the Management of Hypertension.
Hypotension is not yet clearly defined. Generally, adults with systolic BP ≤ 90 mmHg and diastolic BP ≤ 60 mmHg are considered to have low blood pressure."

"1. Sleep on your side. Side sleeping helps prevent your throat tissues and tongue from blocking your airway and reduce the effect of gravity on your airway. 2. Avoid evening alcohol. Alcohol relaxes throat muscles and increases the risk of airway obstruction. 3. Control weight if you're overweight. Weight loss can be effective to improve breathing at night. 4. Get physically active. Exercise strengthens your lungs and makes breathing easier."
"Reference range: 90–100 The rating is for information purposes only. If you feel unwell, seek medical help."
Frequent wake-ups while sleeping interrupt your sleep cycle and decrease sleep quality. Try to relax before bed by reading or taking a bath.
Continue getting good continuous sleep by reading or taking a bath before bed instead of using your phone.
"Koalas don't sleep enough, but they sleep soundly."
"Sharks don't sleep enough, nor do they get enough deep sleep."
"We'll create a recommended daily schedule for you based on your sleep animal to help you create healthier habits."
Turn off your phone and relax
Take a walk to avoid getting sleepy
Data comes from your wearable devices within the last 30 days.

"1. Only data collected by Xiaomi devices can be analyzed. 2. Wear your watch to bed at night. If you don't fall asleep between 8 PM and 7 AM the next day, the data won't be analyzed. 3. Sporadic naps with a total duration of less than 3 hours won't be counted."
Sleep data must meet the following conditions:
Napping for less than 30 minutes in the afternoon can help you recharge, but longer naps may cause you to fall into deep sleep, making you feel groggy when you wake up.

"During the second stage, your heart rate, breathing, and muscle tone continue to drop. Brain waves slow further. Eye movements remain absent. It's harder to wake you up at this point. Typical range: 20%–40%"
"%s We'll use the most recent 7 nights of sleep data to provide analysis and tell you your sleep animal. Only sleep data recorded by your wearable device will be analyzed."
Wear your Xiaomi device to bed.

"Based on brain and body characteristics, sleep stages are categorized into light, deep, and rapid eye movement (REM) sleep. These stages cycle every 90 to 120 minutes, 4 to 6 times each night. Each cycle ends with brief awakenings. Note: It may seem unusual but you don't typically transition through these stages in sequence when you sleep."
"Couldn't save. Your sleep duration is longer than 24 hours."

"There's no set amount of time everyone needs to sleep since it varies with daily schedule, activity level, genetic makeup, and more. The National Sleep Foundation recommends healthy adults get 7 to 9 hours of sleep per night. Some people need as much as 10 hours of sleep while some thrive on as little as 6 hours."
"This month's earliest wake-up time: %1$s | Latest fall-asleep time: %2$s"
"This week's earliest wake-up time: %1$s | Latest fall-asleep time: %2$s"
"Looks like your current environment is noisy. If you're using headphones, use noise cancellation and keep the volume down."
This is just an example report. To get your own sleep report, wear a Xiaomi device to bed every night.
You have a regular sleep schedule.
Wear your device to bed 7 nights in a row to get updated sleep analysis information.
Turn on Advanced monitoring to get REM sleep data
How can I use my device to track sleep?
Exercise can help relieve stress and promote better sleep. However, doing high-intensity exercise within 2 hours of going to bed can make you too energized to fall asleep.
Turn on Advanced monitoring in Sleep settings
Turn on Continuous monitoring in Blood oxygen settings
"During the first stage of sleep, your heart rate and breathing slow, muscles relax, brain waves slow, and eye movements stop. You can be awakened easily at this stage. Typical range: 20%–60%"
"Studies show that REM sleep helps your brain's learning and memory functions. Too much or too little REM sleep can cause irritability and anxiety. Talk to your doctor if you have questions."
"Napping can improve mood and memory. You might consider a nap to make up your sleep debt. But it isn't for everyone. People who have trouble falling asleep at night may want to avoid napping."
To get the most out of a nap, aim to nap for 10 to 20 minutes. Napping for too long may leave you feeling groggy.
Wear your device to bed 7 nights in a row to get more sleep analysis information.
No data. Wear your device to bed.
"You didn't do any exercise right before sleeping."

The best time to fall asleep is between 10-11 PM. Going to bed early helps your body recover more and makes it easier to enter deep sleep. Falling asleep earlier or later than this will decrease your sleep score.

Keeping a regular sleep schedule can help you maintain healthy sleep habits. We recommend falling asleep within 30 minutes of the same time every day. If the variability exceeds 30 minutes, your sleep score will be lower.
Turn on Advanced monitoring to get a detailed sleep score next time you wear the watch to bed.
Allowing this app to autostart makes sleep data more accurate.
Allowing this app to run in the background with no restrictions makes sleep data more accurate.
You have an irregular sleep schedule.
Your sleep score was %s lower than the previous night.
Turn on Advanced monitoring to get more detailed sleep data.
Higher than %s of users in your age group.
Your sleep score was the same as the previous night.
Your sleep score was %s higher than the previous night.

"This phase involves irregular heart rate and breathing. Your brain races, eyes dart around, while your body is temporarily paralyzed. There's a good chance you can recall the dreams when you wake up from REM sleep. Typical range: 10%–30%"
"Once you delete this report, you won't be able to view it again. Delete anyway?"
Brown bears have healthy sleep schedules.
Staying up late and sleeping late can lead to anxiety, insomnia, depression, and other issues. Try to go to bed and get up early.
Going to bed and waking up early is great for your physical and mental health. Keep it up!
Koalas like to stay up late.
Owls like to stay up late.
Penguins go to bed relatively early.
Sheep go to bed relatively early.
Restrict after 10 minutes in the background
Sleep onset was delayed by over 2 hours.
Going to bed early helps your body repair itself. Experts say the best time to go to sleep is between 10-11 PM, as falling asleep at this time can make it easier to enter deep sleep.
"A regular sleep schedule helps build healthy sleep habits. It's recommended to go to sleep at the same time every day, not letting the time vary by more than an hour."
Turn on to keep 100 MB of the latest recordings on your phone and delete older ones automatically to save storage space

"1. Avoid caffeine, alcohol, and heavy meals late in the day. 2. Be active, but avoid vigorous exercise before sleep. 3. Relax and wind down. Set aside your worries and stop mentally challenging tasks before bedtime. 4. Keep your bedroom dark. Exposure to light suppresses the secretion of melatonin, a hormone that initiates sleep. 5. Stick to a sleep schedule."
The National Sleep Foundation recommends healthy adults get 7 to 9 hours of sleep per night.
Similarly, avoid activities or media that will induce strong emotions, either positive or negative.
Avoid eating or drinking stimulating foods and beverages such as alcohol, coffee, strong tea, chocolate, etc. a few hours before bedtime.
Avoid eating or drinking large amounts within a few hours of bedtime to avoid feeling too full to sleep or needing to get up to use the bathroom.
Keep your bedroom at a comfortable temperature and humidity for you. Make it as dark as possible before you sleep to improve sleep quality and increase melatonin production.
Adhere to a regular sleep schedule.
Avoid mentally stimulating activities before bedtime. Instead, take time to rest mentally as well as physically before bed.
Your total sleep duration for today

Getting enough sleep helps you wake up with a healthy body and mind. The American National Sleep Foundation recommends adults get 7-9 hours of sleep each night. More or less sleep than this might negatively affect how you feel the next day.
Record your sleep based on your phone usage, activity stats, as well as fall asleep and wake up time you set.
Wear your Xiaomi device to bed to learn more about your sleep
A sleep record already exists in this time period. Delete the previous record?
Turn on Continuous monitoring in Blood oxygen settings
Turn on Advanced monitoring in Sleep settings
Turn off detection of snoring and talking?

Your blood oxygen level represents the percentage of oxygen in your blood. It can be a useful indicator of how well your circulatory system works. A healthy oxygen saturation level is between 95-100%, but this may vary based on physical condition, altitude, and certain diseases.

"Your watch notifies you when it detects readings below the set level within a set period of time. If you experience shortness of breath, headache, fatigue, or reduced concentration, seek medical attention. You can view more data in the app.
This data is for reference only. If you feel unwell, seek medical advice."
Have you stood up within the last hour?
Stress emojis chart changes in your stress values over time and display them with emojis to help you understand how you might be feeling and make adjustments.

"The evaluation of your current stress level is based on your heart-rate variability (HRV), the time between your heartbeats, as well as your physical activities. Levels: Relaxed: 1–25 Mild: 25–50 Moderate: 51–80 Severe: 81–100."
"1. Your wearable device measures your stress level when you're inactive. 2. You might get blank areas, representing the time periods unable to determine stress due to too many actions."
Stress is a feeling of being under pressure. A healthy amount of stress can help you focus and improve performance, but prolonged stress can result in tiredness and irritability.
Connect to WeChat and Alipay and share steps between apps
Sync workouts and fitness data across devices
Turn on Sync with the cloud to back up your workout and fitness data from your phone, and sync data from other devices. When the feature is on, you can also do the following.
"Looks like there's health data associated with your Xiaomi Account (%1$s). To restore health data, turn on Sync with the cloud. When it's on, you can also:"
You can start a workout on your phone and track your Moving progress
Adults aged 18–⁠64 years should aim for at least 30 minutes per day, 5 times per week of moderate activity.
*Steps, calories, Moving, and standing data are obtained by aggregation and calculation of data from the above sources.
Walking 10000 steps a day can improve your health.
Apart from Steps and Calories, choose another goal.
"Your wearable device doesn't count %s. Set another goal?"
Start a workout, move around, and track progress towards your goals.

"\"Moving\" shows your time doing moderate and vigorous activity. For adults aged 18–⁠64 years, aim for at least 30 minutes per day, 5 times per week of moderate activity. Alternatively, try 75 minutes a week of intense activity. You'll see your \"Moving\" progress when your cadence exceeds 100 SPM or when your heart rate exceeds 65% of your max heart rate."
Note: The feature works with selected smart devices made by Xiaomi.
\"Calories\" shows the number of active calories you burn each day through moving around and exercising. Set the goal based on your weight management plan and calorie consumption.
\"Standing\" shows hours in which you stand up and move around. To counteract sitting all day, stand and move during 12 different hours in the day.

Track your steps, find out a baseline, set a goal, and work toward it one step at a time. Less than 5000 steps per day may indicate sedentary lifestyle. An active person walks between 8000 and 10000 steps a day.
Track daily goals with your phone and wearable device
The average person burns about 200–300 kcal during 30 minutes of running.
To avoid being sedentary, stand up and move around during 12 different hours in the day.
"Your calories burned today were equal to last week's daily average"
"Your Moving time today was equal to last week's daily average"
"Your step count today was equal to last week's daily average"
"Your calories burned today were much lower than last week's daily average"
"Your Moving time today was much lower than last week's daily average"
"Your step count today was much lower than last week's daily average"
"Your calories burned today were much higher than last week's daily average"
"Your Moving time today was much higher than last week's daily average"
"Your step count today was much higher than last week's daily average"

"Your Moving time today was lower than last week's daily average"
"Your step count today was lower than last week's daily average"
"Your calories burned today were higher than last week's daily average"
"Your Moving time today was higher than last week's daily average"
"Your step count today was higher than last week's daily average"
"You didn't reach your standing goal this week. Don't give up!"
Stand up at least once every hour to reach your goals
"You've almost hit your calorie goal. Keep going!"
"You've almost hit your Moving goal. Keep going!"
"You've almost hit your step goal. Keep going!"

Maintaining a constant body temperature is necessary for maintaining metabolism, brain activity, and other vital functions. The average normal body temperature of the human body is between 36℃ and 37℃. Temperatures outside of this range put a person at risk for fever or hypothermia.

"Wearable devices use temperature sensors which may be affected by environmental factors. To help maintain the accuracy of skin temperature measurements: 1. Make sure you've been wearing the watch for at least 10 minutes before measuring skin temperature. 2. Take the measurement in an environment near room temperature (about 25°C). 3. Keep the watch and your wrist dry of water and sweat. 4. Charging the watch and using apps that consume a lot of power will increase the temperature of the watch and may affect skin temperature measurements. Let the watch cool down before measuring. Note that the measurement results are provided for your reference only and are not used for medical purposes."

"This feature measures the skin surface temperature of the part of the body in contact with the watch's sensor. Skin temperature will vary between different parts of the body and is affected by the environment and physiological conditions. The watch can measure skin temperature between 34-42°C. This feature is not intended for medical purposes, nor is it intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease or condition."
Turn on Sync with the cloud before submitting to get your reports faster
"You've reached the daily maximum Vitality score!"
For a more accurate Vitality score
Run for %1$s and keep your heart rate above %2$s

"The Vitality Score is customized based on your age, resting heart rate, maximum heart rate, and workout data from the past 7 days. You can earn Vitality points by exercising while wearing your device. Higher-intensity exercise will earn you more Vitality points in a shorter amount of time. As your Vitality score increases, it becomes more difficult to earn more points."

"Vitality score is a health indicator for the past 7 days. You don't have to exercise a lot on any given day, nor exercise every day; you can earn Vitality points by exercising at any time within the 7-day period. We recommend exercising at least 2-3 times a week to maintain your physical and mental health."
Why is it calculated on a 7-day basis?

"Vitality score can be used to assess the positive impact of personal exercise on health. Regularly reaching a 7-day vitality score of 100 can have significant positive health impacts. Vitality score is based on the WHO Guidelines on Physical Activity and Sedentary Behaviour, which recommend that: All healthy adults engage in at least 150-300 minutes of moderate-intensity exercise or 75-150 minutes of high-intensity exercise per week; or an equivalent combination of moderate and higher intensity exercise. At the same time, a little physical exercise is better than none. Replacing sedentary time with low-intensity exercise also has health benefits."

You can earn up to 80 Vitality points per day, so theoretically you could reach a score of 560 points over 7 days. However, as your score increases, it becomes increasingly difficult to earn more points.
How many Vitality points can I earn?

"The WHO Guidelines on Physical Activity and Sedentary Behaviour recommend that all healthy adults engage in at least 75 minutes of higher-intensity exercise or 150 minutes of moderate-intensity exercise per week. For additional health benefits, a minimum of 300 minutes of moderate intensity activity or 150 minutes of higher intensity activity per week is required; alternatively, a person can engage in a combination of moderate and higher intensity aerobic activity at the same caloric consumption level. When your 7-day Vitality score reaches 60, you've reached WHO's weekly minimum exercise recommendation. For the greatest health benefits, aim for a 7-day Vitality score of 100. Make sure to manage your workout intensity according to your physical health, and try to make it a habit to exercise regularly."
Why set the three goals of 30, 60, and 100 points?

"VO₂ max refers to the maximum volume of oxygen that the human body can absorb per minute during exercise, measured in mL/(kg·min). Endurance exercise relies on oxygen, and so the more oxygen the human body can absorb and use, the more sugar or fat it can burn, providing more power for exercise, and thus the higher its maximum oxygen uptake. People with a higher VO₂ max usually are able to perform more endurance exercise.
To calculate your VO₂ max, wear your device and start an outdoor running workout. Make sure that the workout is of medium or high intensity and lasts for long enough to obtain sufficient data. If the length and intensity of the workout was sufficient, you'll be able to view your VO₂ max data once you're finished.
The rating associated with your VO₂ max is determined based on your age, sex, and VO₂ max value. Fill in your age and sex accurately in the app for best results."
Your end time should not before your start time.

"With an overweight BMI, it's recommended to exercise weekly and increase aerobic exercise such as running. At the same time, control dietary intake, increase dietary fiber and high-quality protein intake, and eat less fried and high-calorie foods."

"With an underweight BMI, it's recommended to maintain a balanced diet with a focus on increasing the intake of high-quality protein, and gradually increase strength training, such as sit-ups and weightlifting."
"With a normal BMI, it's recommended to maintain healthy eating and exercise habits."

"With an obese BMI, especially over the long term, there is a danger of developing symptoms such as heart palpitations, shortness of breath, heat intolerance, and even chronic diseases. It's recommended to change one's lifestyle habits, exercise moderately, and consistently control dietary intake."

"Your heart rate is high. This may be caused by nervousness, excitement, strenuous exercise, etc. This isn't cause for alarm at this time, but if your heart rate continues to be high or you feel palpitations or chest tightness, consult a doctor promptly."
Your heart rate is low. Heart rate changes are closely related to heart health. Maintain a healthy diet and exercise habits to ensure a healthy heart.
Your heart rate is normal. Heart rate changes are closely related to heart health. Maintain a healthy diet and exercise habits to ensure a healthy heart.
Your body fat percentage is high. Exercise more, control your dietary intake, improve your habits, and get adequate sleep.

Your body fat percentage is low, which puts you at risk of malnutrition, fatigue, muscle loss, and decreased immunity. Base your daily diet on easily digestible, high-protein foods, and maintain a balanced diet.
Your body fat percentage is normal, which lessens your risk of disease. Continue to maintain healthy eating habits and moderate exercise.

Your body fat percentage is very high, which can reduce your physical activity and increase the risk of chronic illness. Exercise for about 30 minutes every day and eat mainly vegetables, whole grains, and high quality protein. Limit your intake of high-sugar, high-fat, and high-calorie foods.
"You're very hydrated. Healthy, regular eating and drinking habits can maintain the body's water balance, help digest food better, and increase metabolism."
"You're dehydrated. Make sure you drink enough water. Healthy, regular eating and drinking habits can maintain the body's water balance, help digest food better, and increase metabolism."
"You're properly hydrated. Healthy, regular eating and drinking habits can maintain the body's water balance, help digest food better, and increase metabolism."

Your protein percentage is high. Control your intake of protein-rich foods and increase your intake of cereals, leafy greens, and fruit to reduce the burden on your kidneys and avoid excessive calcium loss.

Your protein percentage is low. Increase your intake of high-quality, protein-rich foods like eggs, fish, milk, and beef, while avoiding excessive fat intake and ensuring you eat fruits and vegetables to aid digestion and supplement vitamins.
Your protein percentage is normal. Continue to eat healthy and exercise appropriately.
Your skeletal muscle mass is excellent. Maintain a balanced diet and avoid fried and high-fat foods. Do aerobic exercise 3 to 4 times a week and stretch after exercising.

Your skeletal muscle mass is low. This may lead to limited joint movement and reduced muscle response, which increases the risk of falls and fractures. Increase your intake of protein-rich foods like fish and shrimp, and perform strength training 3 to 5 times a week.
Your skeletal muscle mass is normal. Continue to maintain a balanced diet and ensure adequate daily protein intake. Do aerobic exercise 3 to 4 times a week and stretch after exercising.
Disclaimer: These results are for your reference only. They are not intended for medical purposes or diagnostic use.
Your waist-to-hip ratio is high, indicating an excess of belly or hip fat. Maintain a balanced diet and engage in more aerobic exercise and abdominal workouts to reduce fat and increase muscle.
Your waist-to-hip ratio is high. This means there is significant fat accumulation in the abdomen or buttocks. Do more aerobic exercise and avoid excessive calorie intake.
Your waist-to-hip ratio is low. Engage in more abdominal and glute exercises to build muscle.
Your waist-to-hip ratio is low. Add abdominal and hip exercises to your workout routine.
Your waist-to-hip ratio is normal. Continue to maintain a balanced diet and adequate exercise.
Your waist-to-hip ratio is within the standard range. Continue eating healthy and exercising appropriately.
For obtaining the frequency of light changes around the finger through the camera in order to determine the heart rate value
What state are you in right now?
"Fully cover the camera with your finger. Wait until the circle turns red."
"During the measurement, place your finger on the camera. Your phone's flash shines a light on your finger and the camera detects color changes in your finger each time your heart beats."

"You can measure your heart rate just by covering your phone's flash and camera with a finger. The flash will be used as a continuous light source, and the camera will detect changes in the blood flow. The images will then be analyzed, and your heart rate will be determined based on the repeated patterns."

"Take multiple measurements to make sure your current reading is accurate. The results provided here are for your reference only. This measurement method can't substitute professional medical equipment."
"You're completely relaxed or have just woken up."
"Can't measure heart rate while using Split screen"
To be able to track changes in blood flow and measure your heart rate, allow this app to access fingerprint scanner.

Blood flows to your fingers with every heartbeat. Bright light in the fingerprint scanner area under the screen allows us to track the changes in your blood flow, analyze the patterns, and convert them into heart rate values.

"Blood isn't completely opaque; therefore, light can pass through it. With every heartbeat, blood flows to your fingers, blocking more light than between the heartbeats. Bright light in the fingerprint scanner area under the screen allows us to track the changes in your blood flow, analyze the patterns, and convert them into heart rate values."

"Note: Make sure your finger fully covers the fingerprint icon during the measurement. Don't apply force, as it might block blood flow in your fingertip and make the results inaccurate. This measurement is provided for your reference only. It can't replace medical tests."
Our tests show that this method measures your heart rate with an error of only ≤3 BPM.
Cover the icon with your finger
Normal heart rate ranges from 60 to 100 beats per minute. A heart rate lower than 60 BPM is a sign of bradycardia, while a heart rate over 100 BPM is accepted as tachycardia in adults.
"To be able to measure heart rate, allow this app to access your phone's camera."
Fully cover flash and camera with one finger

Measuring your heart rate immediately after working out can help you adjust your exercising habits, as workouts of different intensity have different optimal heart rate zones. If your heart rate is too high, the activity might be detrimental to your health, leading to dizziness, chest tightness, and other risks. Low heart rate might be a sign of low effectiveness of a particular workout.
"Your heart rate tells us that you're engaging in physical activity of relatively high intensity. Your heart and lungs are working hard."
"Your heart rate tells us that you're engaging in physical activity of high intensity. Your heart and lungs are working hard. Pay attention to your state and stop exercising if you feel unwell."

"Your heart rate tells us that you're engaging in physical activity of relatively low intensity. It's suitable for warming up and doing simple exercises. People with various health conditions are recommended to do exercises of low to moderate intensity."
"Your heart rate tells us that you're engaging in physical activity of low intensity. It stimulates your body to a certain extent without requiring much energy."

"Your heart rate tells us that you're engaging in physical activity of moderate intensity. It's recommended that most healthy adults engage in moderate to high-intensity exercise for a total of 150 minutes per week."

Normal heart rate is maintained by the human body during daily activities, and ranges from 60 to 100 beats per minute. A heart rate lower than 60 BPM is a sign of bradycardia, while a heart rate over 100 BPM is accepted as tachycardia in adults.

Your current heart rate is too fast. Excessive physical activity, drinking alcohol, heavy physical labor, nervousness, anxiety, or taking certain drugs may cause physiological tachycardia. Additionally, cardiovascular diseases, anemia, hyperthyroidism, hypoxia, heart failure, and other diseases might be the signs of pathological tachycardia. If you feel unwell, please consult your physician in time.

"Your current heart rate is normal. Your heart can cope with stress well, and your body can resist external pressure. However, you shouldn't forget that heart rate changes might be the signs of heart disease. Always keep an eye on your heart rate, especially during exercise."

"Your current heart rate is too slow. About 15% of people can experience physiological bradycardia, which is a slow sinus rhythm lower than 60 BPM. If this condition doesn't cause dizziness, blackouts, vertigo, or fainting, you likely won't need any treatment. However, if you experience chest tightness or other symptoms, please consult your physician in time."

Your resting heart rate is faster than normal which might be the sign of tachycardia. A low-salt and oil-reduced diet, weight loss, quitting smoking and alcohol, mental health awareness, and physical activity might help you to slow down your resting heart rate.

"Your resting heart rate is normal. Resting heart rate is the number of times your heart beats per minute when you're at rest. The best time to measure your resting heart rate is when you wake up in the morning, while still lying in bed and not doing any physical activity. Take some time to breathe deeply before measuring your resting heart rate to completely relax your body."

Your resting heart rate is slower than normal which might be the sign of bradycardia. Extended periods of slow heartbeat may cause ischemia and hypoxia, as well as other cardiovascular and cerebrovascular disorders. Resting heart rate is closely related to your diet, activity, stress levels, sleep habits, and overall physical condition. Maintain a healthy lifestyle and pay attention to your body in order to avoid problems. If you experience chest tightness, dizziness, blackouts, vertigo, or fainting, please consult your physician in time.

"Resting heart rate is the number of times your heart beats per minute when you're at rest. Typically, a resting heart rate ranges from 55 to 80 BPM. However, it varies with age, gender, and other factors."

resources.string:
"本内测软件尚处于开发测试过程中，仅为验证功能效果及测试稳定性释放给部分用户，所有内容应作为机密对待，在使用过程中请注意：
1.1 App稳定程度低于线上版本，可能存在功能不稳定或无法正常使用、数据丢失的情况，请谨慎参与测试。
1.2 请使用与内测报名时相同的小米账号登录App，否则将导致数据异常并无法参与测试礼品领取。
1.3 本着自愿原则，您可随时退出本次内测，删除本内测软件，重新下载原有正式版本软件进行使用。
1.4 当前版本仅支持设备下列的联动使用，更多设备将逐步开放支持：
· 小米手环5、6标准版和NFC版 · Redmi手环 · 小米手表Color、小米手表Color运动版、Xiaomi Watch Color2 · Redmi手表、Redmi手表2 · Xiaomi Watch S1 · 米家跑步机"
您当前登录的小米账号不具备测试资格
请同意内测协议后继续

If you don't wish to provide any personal information, you can choose to use Basic mode, and this app will only request permission to connect to the network. In Basic mode, you can still access sports and health-related articles, but may not be able to use many other features of the app."
"To provide you with additional services while you're using the app, we might need the following permissions:"

To provide additional services, we might ask for permission to make calls, record audio, use Bluetooth and camera, send notifications and SMS, as well as access your location, activity info, calendar, and device info. You can always adjust your permissions preferences in Settings.

Welcome to Mi Fitness! You can use this app to manage your devices, track your workouts, and view fitness data. This app needs to connect to the internet to work normally.

Welcome to Mi Fitness. You can use this app to manage your devices, track your workouts, and view fitness data. We shall protect your personal information in accordance with the relevant laws, regulations, and privacy policies. To be able to work normally, this app needs to connect to the internet.
